comments:
After creating some custom formatters in the debug view, I suddenly wasn't able
to view _any_ variable. All I got when selecting a variable to have its value
displayed was a brief error message and the following in the log:

I tracked the problem down to the detail formatter configuration:

The config file causing the Exception:
eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime\.settings\org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui.prefs
------------------------------------------------------------------------
#Tue Dec 07 14:51:34 CET 2004
org.eclipse.debug.ui.VariableView.org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui.show_null_entries=true
eclipse.preferences.version=1
org.eclipse.debug.ui.ExpressionView.org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui.show_null_entries=true
org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui.javaDebug.alertHCRFailed=false
org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui.detail_formatters=de.systemagmbh.products.jeqs.gemeqs.EventReportDefinition,variableListTable.toString();,1,de.systemagmbh.jesc.gui.table.CSysAttributeTableModel,getColumnCount(),1,de.systemagmbh.products.jsecs2drv.SiiList,toSml(true);,1,de.systemagmbh.products.jsecs2drv.SiiMessage,toSml(true);,1,javax.swing.tree.TreePath,getPath(),1,de.systemagmbh.products.jsecs2drv.SiiItem,//toSml(true);\r\ngetValue();,1,java.util.HashMap$Entry<K,V>,getValue().toString(),1,java.util.Hashtable,String
s \= toString ();\r\nreturn s.replaceAll("\u0000 "\u0000"\u0000\\n");,1
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Removing the (obviously flawed) org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui.detail_formatters entry
fixed my problem, but it would be nice if stuff like this wouldn't happen in the
first place.

Regards,

Kai
